00040 int main(int argc, char* argv[])
00041 {
00042     if(argc < 3)
00043     {
00044         printUsage();
00045         exit(1);
00046     }
00047 
00048     Knowledge::EncodeType encode = Knowledge::ENCODE_TYPE_EUCJP;
00049 
00050     const char* srcDir;
00051     const char* destDir;
00052     srcDir = destDir = 0;
00053 
00054     if(argc == 5)
00055     {
00056         if(strcmp(argv[1], "--encode") != 0)
00057         {
00058             cerr << "unknown command option " << argv[1] << endl;
00059             printUsage();
00060             exit(1);
00061         }
00062 
00063         encode = Knowledge::decodeEncodeType(argv[2]);
00064         if(encode == Knowledge::ENCODE_TYPE_NUM)
00065         {
00066             cerr << "unknown encode type " << argv[2] << endl;
00067             printUsage();
00068             exit(1);
00069         }
00070 
00071         srcDir = argv[3];
00072         destDir = argv[4];
00073     }
00074     else if(argc == 3)
00075     {
00076         srcDir = argv[1];
00077         destDir = argv[2];
00078     }
00079     else
00080     {
00081         cerr << "The number of command options is wrong." << endl;
00082         printUsage();
00083         exit(1);
00084     }
00085 
00086     // create knowledge
00087     JMA_Factory* factory = JMA_Factory::instance();
00088     Knowledge* knowledge = factory->createKnowledge();
00089 
00090     // set encoding of destination files
00091     knowledge->setEncodeType(encode);
00092 
00093     // encoding
00094     int r = knowledge->encodeSystemDict(srcDir, destDir);
00095 
00096     delete knowledge;
00097 
00098     // print result
00099     if(r == 1)
00100     {
00101         cout << "succeeded";
00102     }
00103     else
00104     {
00105         cout << "failed";
00106     }
00107     cout << " in encoding from " << srcDir << " to " << destDir << endl;
00108 
00109     return 0;
